title: Quipu
summary: Quipu (also spelled khipu) are recording devices fashioned from strings historically used by a number of cultures in the region of Andean South America.[1] Knotted strings for collecting data, government management and keeping records were  also used by  the ancient Chinese, Tibetans and Japanese,[2][3][4][5] but such practices should not be confused with the quipu, which refers only to the Andean method.
